decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game by leveraging its mana ramp and removal spells. The key concept revolves around using cards like Omnath, Uro, and Wrenn and Six to generate value and gain card advantage while keeping the opponent's threats in check. The inclusion of counterspells like Cryptic Command, Mana Leak, and Force of Negation allows for disruption and protection. The deck also utilizes land synergy with Field of the Dead and Mystic Sanctuary to generate additional threats and recur powerful spells. The mana base is finely tuned to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant) to generate a lot of mana quickly. The deck aims to control the game by using powerful colorless spells like Karn Liberated, Karn, the Great Creator, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes threats like Walking Ballista, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Wurmcoil Engine to close out the game once control has been established. The deck also includes cards like Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's graveyard and board state.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a variety of powerful spells and creatures to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also generating value over time. By utilizing cards like Cryptic Command, Path to Exile, and Force of Negation, the deck can efficiently deal with threats and maintain board control. Additionally, the deck incorporates powerful land options like Field of the Dead and Omnath, Locus of Creation to generate additional resources and overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence.

The deck is focused on playing aggressive and quickly reducing the opponent's life total. It utilizes cards with high power and low mana cost, such as Death's Shadow and Scourge of the Skyclaves, to deal large amounts of damage. The deck also includes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the opponent's board and hand. The combination of card draw spells like Mishra's Bauble and efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Dismember helps maintain tempo and efficiency. The deck is built around the synergy of reducing its own life total, triggering effects and enabling powerful plays.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the combo of Ad Nauseam and Angel's Grace to draw the deck and win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Lightning Storm. It aims to use fast mana sources like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism to generate the necessary mana to execute the combo as quickly as possible. The deck also includes Pact of Negation and Spoils of the Vault for protection and additional card selection. The inclusion of cards like Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand helps to set up the combo and ensure a smooth execution.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the combo of Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Spike Feeder to gain infinite life and create an infinitely large creature. The deck uses cards like Collected Company and Eladamri's Call to tutor for combo pieces, while cards like Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf help ramp up mana quickly. Conclave Mentor and Auriok Champion provide additional synergy and protection, creating a powerful and hard-to-interact-with engine that can overwhelm opponents with a massive life total and creature.

This deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent while utilizing powerful control cards like Cryptic Command and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay to handle threats. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides card advantage and life gain, while cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation help to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements while also including utility lands like Mystic Sanctuary and Field of Ruin.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counter spells, card advantage, and value engines like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Wilderness Reclamation. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Negation and Cryptic Command, while also generating incremental advantage with cards like Wrenn and Six and Mystic Sanctuary. Additionally, the deck has a win condition in Field of the Dead, which can create an overwhelming board presence if left unchecked. Overall, the deck excels at outlasting opponents and grinding out wins through attrition.

This deck aims to quickly amass mana and play powerful land-based ramp cards to quickly bring out Primeval Titan and overwhelm the opponent with giant creatures. Using cards like Amulet of Vigor and Explore to generate additional lands quickly, while also using Karn, the Great Creator to shut down opposing strategies. The deck also includes utility lands and creatures to provide additional support and flexibility in dealing with various situations. The goal is to set up a strong board presence and win the game in a few powerful turns.

This deck aims to disrupt and control the opponent's board with cards like Force of Negation and Electrodominance while setting up a big payoff with cards like Crashing Footfalls and Greater Gargadon. By utilizing Cascade mechanics with cards like As Foretold and Cascade spells, the deck is able to cast powerful spells like Restore Balance for free. The goal is to establish a board advantage and win the game through overwhelming tempo swings and efficient card advantage.

This deck focuses on casting an abundance of free spells and using cards like Electrodominance and As Foretold to cast Restore Balance, which forces both players to sacrifice their lands and creatures, creating a massive swing in board state. The deck aims to use this imbalance to quickly overwhelm the opponent with tokens generated by cards like Crashing Footfalls and Greater Gargadon. By carefully managing resources and timing, the deck seeks to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building a powerful board presence to secure victory.

The main concept of the deck is to use aggressive tactics to apply early pressure while also maintaining control through counterspells and removal spells. The deck utilizes efficient creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl, Spell Queller, and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to establish a strong board presence. It also includes disruptive elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Furthermore, the inclusion of Stoneforge Mystic allows for the tutoring of powerful equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Sword of Fire and Ice, which provide additional threats and advantages in combat.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures like Death's Shadow and Scourge of the Skyclaves to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's hand. Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows the player to recur low-cost creatures and keep the pressure on. The deck also includes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Bomat Courier to draw cards and maintain card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through aggressive plays and resource management.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards using cards like Stinkweed Imp and Cathartic Reunion, then utilize graveyard recursion with cards like Life from the Loam and Golgari Thug to bring back powerful creatures like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of threats from the graveyard, while also using cards like Creeping Chill for additional reach. The combo aspect of this deck involves efficiently dredging through the library to set up powerful board states and ultimately win the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing graveyard synergy to quickly fill the graveyard with cards and trigger abilities that allow cards to be cast from the graveyard. The goal is to mill through the deck, bringing back key creatures and dealing incremental damage to the opponent. The deck is designed to be fast and aggressive, leveraging the graveyard as a resource to overwhelm the opponent. It aims to set up a powerful board state and put pressure on the opponent quickly, before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a combo involving Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Spike Feeder to gain infinite life and create an infinitely large creature. The deck utilizes cards like Collected Company and Eladamri's Call to find the key pieces, while also including cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Auriok Champion to protect the combo. Additional support comes from cards like Utopia Sprawl to ramp and Conclave Mentor to bolster the team. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with a massive life total and creature.
